page.title: 07MILTONDUFF DISTILLERY
page.content: The wash from the fermenters is pumped to the washcharger which supplies the stills.All the alcohols are removed by distillation and the liquid called Low Wines collects in a receiver.The Low Wines are pumped back to the Feints Charger from which they go into the Spirit Still for a second distillation The new malt spirit is reduced to maturation strength before being filled into oak barrels to mature. The barrels are stored in the bonded warehouse for three years and sometimes more The oldest barrel has been in the warehouse for over twenty years.The owner of the whisky will remove it from the bonded warehouse when it reaches the point of maturity.It is only then that the Excise Duty will be paid.
